intro: Cephaelis tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of South Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
